Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • Server
  • class Server
extends java.lang.Object
    Models a Server. A server has the amount of time to takes to serve a Customer and a Customer that it is currently serving.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private Customer currentlyServing
      The Customer that the Server is currently serving.
      private double serviceTime
      Amount of time that the Server will take to serve a Customer.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor Description
      private Server​(Customer currentlyServing, double serviceTime)
      Constructs a Server.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      (package private) boolean canServe​(Customer a)
      Check whether the Server can serve a Customer.
      (package private) boolean canWait​(Customer a)
      Check if the Server can "queue" the Customer to wait.
      (package private) static Server emptyServer​(double serviceTime)
      A static Constructor to initialise an empty Server.
      (package private) Customer serve()
      Serves the Customer.
      (package private) Customer setWaitingReservation​(Customer a)
      Set a reservation for after the Customer finishes waiting
      (package private) Server updateServer​(Customer a)
      Update the Server with the new Customer it is serving.
      (package private) double waitingTime​(Customer a)
      Amount of time the Customer has waited.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • serviceTime

        private final double serviceTime
        Amount of time that the Server will take to serve a Customer.

      • currentlyServing

        private final Customer currentlyServing
        The Customer that the Server is currently serving.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Server

        private Server​(Customer currentlyServing,
               double serviceTime)
        Constructs a Server.
        Parameters:
        currentlyServing - Takes in a Customer that the Server is serving.
        serviceTime - Takes in the amount of time needed for a Server to finish serving a Customer

    • Method Detail

      • emptyServer

        static Server emptyServer​(double serviceTime)
        A static Constructor to initialise an empty Server.
        Parameters:
        serviceTime - Takes in amount of time needed for the Server to finish serving a Customer
        Returns:
        An empty server. The Customer stored inside it is "fake", representing an empty Customer

      • canServe

        boolean canServe​(Customer a)
        Check whether the Server can serve a Customer.
        Parameters:
        a - Incoming Customer
        Returns:
        True if the Customer can be served

      • canWait

        boolean canWait​(Customer a)
        Check if the Server can "queue" the Customer to wait.
        Parameters:
        a - Incoming Customer
        Returns:
        True if there are no other Customers currently waiting

      • updateServer

        Server updateServer​(Customer a)
        Update the Server with the new Customer it is serving.
        Parameters:
        a - New Customer the Server is serving
        Returns:
        A new Server with the new Customer stored inside

      • serve

        Customer serve()
        Serves the Customer.
        Returns:
        Calls upon the Customer getServed method to update the Customer

      • setWaitingReservation

        Customer setWaitingReservation​(Customer a)
        Set a reservation for after the Customer finishes waiting
        Parameters:
        a - The Customer currently waiting
        Returns:
        Calls upon the Customer finishWaiting method

      • waitingTime

        double waitingTime​(Customer a)
        Amount of time the Customer has waited.
        Parameters:
        a - The waiting Customer
        Returns:
        Amount of time the waiting Customer has waited for.
